CONCLUSION: Violation of P1-1;Just satisfaction dismissed (out of time)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) expropriated a plot of land belonging to the applicant . A committee of experts assessed the value of the plot and the relevant amount was paid to her when the expropriation took place .

CARDINAL . Following the applicant ’s request for increased compensation , on DATE ORG of First - instance awarded her an additional compensation of MONEY ( TRL ) plus interest at the statutory rate applicable at the date of the court ’s decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for rectification .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG paid the amount of GPE CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL to the applicant , interest included .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an application with the Court .

CARDINAL . After the application was communicated to the Government , the applicant was requested to submit her observations on the merits of the case and also her just satisfaction claims until DATE . However , she failed to submit her observations within the required time - limit . She did not request any extension of time , either .

CARDINAL . NORP By registered letter of CARDINAL DATE the applicant was informed that ORG had not received her observations and just satisfaction claims and that the ORG may strike a case out of its list of cases where the circumstances lead to the conclusion that the applicant does not intend to pursue the application .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted her observations on the merits of the case . However , she failed to submit her claims for just satisfaction .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice are set out in the Aka v. GPE judgment of DATE ( Reports of Judgments and Decisions CARDINAL-VI , pp . DATE , § § DATE ) .
